text: I enjoyed the game, but the splitting timelines mechanic broke the immersion for me. After the first split and I had to start back at the correct decision, I got upset and didn't continue. Did anyone else enjoy that, or did you just overlook it?
author: Neftolis Zulander

text: That's too bad for you, I did enjoy the game. The splitting timelines and travelling back and forth in between them was pretty interesting.
author: keioII

text: You can pretty much jump to the nodes where you have to make a new decision. Twasnt that difficult and you also can skip the text duh!
author: Mar'kusi Rosenburg

text: My favourite jRPG on the DS! Wonderful game with amazing music.
author: SwiftxFlame

text: Has this game been published in Europe?

Well it's not like the DS is region locked, you could import it and play it legit on your DS or even 3DS (since the DS GAMES aren't region locked)
author: Konradix05

text: I always like and favorite Radiant Historia!
author: Rusa

text: I love this game. It's got an inventive concept, a fascinating story, interesting characters, a creative combat system and of course an amazing soundtrack. RPG fans old and new would adore this game.
author: Medal Melodies

text: It truly was a fantastic surprise. I only wish it had garnered a bit more attention than it did.
author: Austin L

text: i bought this game since i saw the LP from HCBailly and man it´s - i have to think about this one carefully- awesome :D
author: sarcomaful

text: This game was amazing. Nice upload, Supra

author: MageKirby

text: Easily one of my favourite DS games of all time. The characters, story and especially the music are all so good! Shimomura has never let me down with her compositions!
author: Cakeman777

text: Now this game was a jewel. Its so easy to overlook this game when looking for games in the DS library. I am glad I was recommended this game because man it is good.
author: Raphael Silva

text: Such a quality game.
author: Obsidian Wolf

text: One of the better RPGs for the DS, a new solid IP being a breath of fresh air in a sea of sequels. I'm still blown away by such a high sound quality coming out of the DS speakers. It makes Shimomura's music truly shine. I remember immediately paying attention to this particular theme, I love its structure and how it slows down in the end.
author: SupraDarky

text: Oh wow. This really is quality music coming from the DS.  It even rivals Okamiden as one of the best soundtracks that i have heard from a DS game in terms of sound quality.  I have so much respect for Shimomura.  This makes me even more excited to hear the music she will be doing for FF XV.
author: Eric C.

text: still need to beat this game, I got this game solely because of the music. shimomura is quickly becoming one of my favorite video game composers.
author: Laughing Man
